title: Kidnapping for Ransom - Rohtak
summary: A 14-year-old boy is reported missing from Rohtak. Family receives a ransom call two hours later demanding ₹5 lakhs.

stages.info:
Boy (14) missing from outside tuition centre near Delhi Road, Rohtak.
Missing for 90 minutes.
Mother received suspicious call asking if the child had 'reached home'.
stages.question: What should be your FIRST official step?
options: Register FIR promptly & begin parallel search operations
Wait 24 hours before registering FIR
Tell family to search neighborhood on their own
Hold press briefing immediately
stages.feedback_wrong: Kidnapping of minor requires immediate FIR and search as per law; delay is unlawful.
stages.next_info: FIR registered. Local inquiry reveals a white Swift car near the tuition centre around the same time.

stages.info: Witness says a white Swift with tinted windows was seen repeatedly circling the area.
stages.question: Best next investigative step?
options: Obtain nearby CCTV footage & trace vehicle path
Set up nakas in entire Haryana blindly
Call vehicle owner records department without any details
Wait for ransom call before doing anything
stages.feedback_wrong: CCTV tracing is the quickest way to confirm movement and registration details.
stages.next_info: CCTV shows Swift heading towards Jhajjar Road with partial plate HR12.

stages.info:
CCTV: Swift moving towards rural road.
Family receives ransom call: demand ₹5 lakhs; boy crying in background.
stages.question: Strategy now?
options: Record ransom call, involve cyber team for virtual number tracing
Ask family to negotiate directly without police monitoring
Arrange ransom money and wait without logging evidence
Start random raids in Rohtak city
stages.feedback_wrong: Ransom calls must be recorded and traced with cyber support.
stages.next_info: Call traced to temporary SIM activated with forged Aadhaar near Meham.

stages.info: SIM activation shop in Meham confirms fake Aadhaar used by two youths.
stages.question: Logical next step?
options: Obtain CCTV & take statement of SIM seller immediately
Arrest SIM seller without checking evidence
Ignore SIM activation lead
Start combing operations without intel
stages.feedback_wrong: SIM sellers are key witnesses & CCTV can reveal faces.
stages.next_info: CCTV shows two suspects, one wearing a distinctive yellow hoodie.

stages.info:
Suspects seen near Meham.
Last tower dump shows mobile near Chiri village.
stages.question: What should be done next?
options: Deploy discreet teams near Chiri & verify abandoned structures
Launch loud siren search in entire district
Delay action to avoid disturbing suspects
Circle only the main highway points
stages.feedback_wrong: Discreet close-range reconnaissance is essential to avoid harming the child.
stages.next_info: Teams find tyre marks near a cattle shed; boy's slipper found.

stages.info: Evidence suggests boy is held in or near old cattle shed.
stages.question: Next operational step?
options: Silent cordon & containment operation, then tactical entry
Rush entire police team with loud speakers
Ask family to approach kidnappers directly
Wait overnight to act in daylight
stages.feedback_wrong: High-risk rescue demands silent cordon & controlled entry.
stages.next_info: Cordon executed; boy rescued safely. Two accused flee.

stages.question: Final step?
options: Register supplementary sections, launch manhunt & freeze suspect assets
Close case as 'solved' because child is back
Pressure victim family to withdraw FIR
Ignore absconding accused
stages.feedback_wrong: Absconding accused must be traced and supplementary investigation completed.
